remarks: Prove a subring by closure (definition version).  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Dec-2014.)
statement:
issubrngd.s $e |- ( ph -> S = ( I |`s D ) ) $.
issubrngd.z $e |- ( ph -> .0. = ( 0g ` I ) ) $.
issubrngd.p $e |- ( ph -> .+ = ( +g ` I ) ) $.
issubrngd.ss $e |- ( ph -> D C_ ( Base ` I ) ) $.
issubrngd.zcl $e |- ( ph -> .0. e. D ) $.
issubrngd.acl $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. D /\ y e. D ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. D ) $.
issubrngd.ncl $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. D ) -> ( ( invg ` I ) ` x ) e. D ) $.
issubrngd.o $e |- ( ph -> .1. = ( 1r ` I ) ) $.
issubrngd.t $e |- ( ph -> .x. = ( .r ` I ) ) $.
issubrngd.ocl $e |- ( ph -> .1. e. D ) $.
issubrngd.tcl $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. D /\ y e. D ) -> ( x .x. y ) e. D ) $.
issubrngd.g $e |- ( ph -> I e. Ring ) $.
issubrngd2 $p |- ( ph -> D e. ( SubRing ` I ) ) $.
$d .+ x y $.
$d .0. x y $.
$d .x. x y $.
$d D x y $.
$d I x y $.
$d S x y $.
$d ph x y $.
